| Section3 = {{Chembox Hazards Solubility = MainHazards = FlashPt =
| Autoignition =
  }} }} 'Nicotinamide adenine dinucleotide phosphate', abbreviated 'NADP{{+}}'
  (or, in older notation, 'TPN' (triphosphopyridine nucleotide)), is a coenzyme
  used in anabolic reactions, such as lipid and nucleic acid synthesis, which
  require NADPH as a reducing agent.

NADPH is the reduced form of NADP. NADP differs from NAD{{+}} in the presence of
an additional phosphate group on the 2' position of the ribose ring that carries
the adenine moiety.
